title: Median of Two Sorted Arrays
description:
Given two sorted arrays nums1 and nums2 of size m and n respectively, return the median of the two sorted arrays.

The overall run time complexity should be O(log (m+n)).
task:
Find the median value after merging the two sorted arrays.
If the total number of elements is even, return the average of the two middle elements.
inputFormat:
Line 1:m — the length of the first array
Line 2:nums1 elements (space-separated)
Line 3:n — the length of the second array
Line 4:nums2 elements (space-separated)
outputFormat: A single floating-point number representing the median of the two sorted arrays.
sampleInput:
// Size of nums1

2

// nums1 elements

1 3

// Size of nums2

1

// nums2 elements

2
sampleExplanation: The merged array is [1, 2, 3] and the median is 2.
hints: A brute force approach merges the arrays in O(m+n) time, but we need O(log(m+n)).
Think about Binary Search. You want to cut both arrays such that elements on the left are smaller than elements on the right.
Try to find a partition point in the smaller array and calculate the corresponding partition in the larger array.
